title: David Westley
text:
David Westley (born 7 June 1974) is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. A Papua New Guinea international front-rower, he played club football for the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>, with whom he won the <a href="1994%20Winfield%20Cup">1994 Winfield Cup</a> Premiership before spending time with the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> and the <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a>.
Playing career.
Westley's junior club was the <a href="Cairns%20Kangaroos">Cairns Kangaroos</a>. He was Canberra's Rookie of the Year in 1993, and was a part of the <a href="Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> winning side in 1994 as they defeated <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown</a> in the decider. As of the <a href="2020%20NRL%20season">2020 NRL season</a>, this has been Canberra's last premiership victory.
The following year, Westley was selected to play for <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> in the <a href="1995%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1995 World Cup</a> in England. Westley played for Canberra until the end of the <a href="1999%20NRL%20season">1999 NRL season</a> before departing the club to sign with <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta</a>. Westley played 25 games for Parramatta in his first season at the club as they reached the preliminary final against <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane</a> which Parramatta lost 16–10 at <a href="Stadium%20Australia">Stadium Australia</a>. He played eight games the following year at Parramatta finished as runaway <a href="Minor%20Premiers">Minor Premiers</a>. In 2002, he signed for the <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a> playing twelve games. He then returned to <a href="Cairns">Cairns</a> to coach the senior side.
